title: Despite fears and disappointments, Democrats are uniting behind Joe Biden
summary: The party is optimistic that the American president will win the November election, despite fears about his health and cognitive faculties.

title: Abortion in the Constitution: Is Macron a feminist?
summary: President Emmanuel Macron will hold a ceremony to enact the law on International Women's Rights Day. He is looking to reap the political benefits of the constitutional protection of abortion, though it originated from Parliament.

title: Israel unveils plan for Muslims to visit Al-Aqsa Mosque during Ramadan
summary: For Palestinian worshippers, praying at the third-holiest site in Islam is a centerpiece of Ramadan. The Israeli announcement came amid high tensions because of the nearly five months of fighting in the Gaza Strip between the country and Hamas.

title: Haiti: State of emergency declared in the capital plagued by gang violence, 'Everyone is afraid.'
summary: The government has declared a 72-hour state of emergency in the city of Port-au-Prince, which has been gripped by a surge in violence since February 29. Heavily armed gangs aiming to overthrow Prime Minister Ariel Henry are behind the escalation.

title: Real Sociedad - PSG: Will Mbappé be untouchable in the Champions League?
summary: Since his decision to leave the club at the end of the season, his playing time in the league has been drastically cut. Will the same rule be applied in the Champions League?

title: Riken Yamamoto wins 2024 Pritzker architecture prize
summary: Aged 78, the Japanese architect has produced a prolific yet unspectatular body of work, mainly in Asia, interweaving interior and exterior, public and private spaces.

title: Macron urges Ukraine's allies not to be 'cowardly'
summary: The French president is on a visit to Prague to clarify his country's standpoint on a Czech plan to buy weapons outside Europe for Ukraine.

title: 2024 US elections: All you need to know about Super Tuesday
summary: With Joe Biden and Donald Trump dominating their respective party races, there is little suspense ahead of this usually pivotal day.

title: Investigation opened into 2021 Depardieu sexual assault complaint
summary: Paris prosecutors opened an investigation following a complaint from a set decorator accusing Gérard Depardieu of sexual assault during a shoot in 2021.

title: Chablis, a flourishing Burgundy wine beating the odds
summary: This appellation, which increased the size of its vineyards sixfold in 40 years, is enjoying growing international success.

title: Paris Olympics 2024: 326,000 tickets will be released for opening ceremony
summary: Organizers have scaled back the ceremony in the face of resistance from French security services.

title: After Alexei Navalny's death, what's left of Putin's opposition?
summary: The top Kremlin critic died on February 16 in an Arctic prison colony and many are now wondering what's left of the opposition to Vladimir Putin in Russia.

title: Paris City Hall searched over mayor's trip to Tahiti
summary: Prosecutors have opened a preliminary investigation to shed light on the conditions of Anne Hidalgo's controversial trip to the Pacific in the autumn.

title: Strengthening gender equality could double global growth, study shows
summary: According to a World Bank study published on March 4, women have less than two-thirds of men's legal rights, and only half of them are part of the global workforce.

title: Prague and Berlin zoos to reintroduce endangered horses to Kazakhstan
summary: Forty Przewalki's horses will be delivered to a Kazakhstan steppe in June in a joint project between two European zoos, it was announced on Tuesday.

title: Macron said French people are spending less on food. What do the numbers say?
summary: Statistics show that the proportion of income spent on food has fallen the most since the post-war period. But it is housing, not leisure spending, that weighs most heavily on household budgets.

title: ICC issues arrest warrants for Russian officers over strikes on Ukraine
summary: The International Criminal Court issued warrants for Sergei Ivanovich Kobylash and Viktor Nikolayevich Sokolov, an army lieutenant general and a navy admiral, for 'directing attacks at civilian' targets and 'inhumane acts.'

title: Germany blames Ukraine war talks leak on 'individual error'
summary: A 38-minute recording of the talks, in which the officers debated the possible use of German-made Taurus missiles by Ukraine, was posted Friday on Russian social media.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Black wins at Hermès and Valentino
summary: Both houses highlighted this color, the French brand in a biker-inspired leather collection and the Italian in a glamorous tulle and chiffon wardrobe, for an undeniably refined effect.

title: Biden and Trump secure Super Tuesday victories, move closer to a November rematch
summary: Trump's longshot challenger, former UN ambassador Nikki Haley, has failed to provide a significant obstacle in the former's president path to the nomination, losing every state.

title: Terrorism remains the key challenge at the Paris 2024 Games
summary: Speaking before the Senate, French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin disclosed that one million security investigations will be carried out between now and the start of the Olympics, among other initiatives.

title: Senegal: Opposition leader Ousmane Sonko, first to be released under partial amnesty?
summary: The government's bill is scheduled for review and voting by MPs by Wednesday. However, the text, intended to alleviate political tensions stemming from the postponement of the presidential election, is already facing criticism.

title: Quebec citizens mobilize against mining frenzy and its impact on the environment
summary: Quebec's subsoil, rich in 28 critical and strategic minerals, has attracted mining companies all over the world. At the local level, however, mining projects are facing growing resistance from elected officials and citizens.

title: Tesla German plant halts production after attack claimed by far-left group
summary: High-voltage lines were set on fire in the carmaker's only European factory on Tuesday in an act of 'sabotage' claimed by Vulkangruppe, which highlighted concerns about the plant's environmental impact.

title: Biden and Trump head for another face-off, after a surprise-less Super Tuesday
summary: The former president triumphed, confirming his stranglehold on the Republican Party and crushing his rival, Nikki Haley, who won only the state of Vermont.

title: Super Tuesday: In North Carolina, voters confirm Trump's grip on the GOP
summary: The former president clinched a predictable victory in the state on Tuesday. But the vote was more notable for the nomination of Mark Robinson, a candidate known for his anti-LGBTQ and antisemitic rhetoric, in the gubernatorial race.
